p: All of the plant extracts (listed in Table 1) were tested against three different viruses i.e., yellow fever, chikungunya virus (CHIKV ), and enterovirus 71. One-third of the plants were active against these viruses. Among them, K. pinnata (EC 50 = 6.1 μg/mL, SI = 4.29) , A. tomentosa (EC 50 = 7.79 μg/mL, SI = 4.69), and P. polyphylla (EC 50 = 8.74 μg/mL, SI = 1.75) were active against CHIKV, C. serratum was active against yellow fever virus, with EC 50 of 15.9 μg/mL, and T. chebula (EC 50 = 10.6 μg/mL, SI = 5.94) was active against enterovirus 71 ( Table 4).
